panels.description: -- BR7A - This query returns the average planned and unplanned downtime, average uptime and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
--    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS planned_downtime
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
--    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
            GROUP BY b.host_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Unplanned Downtime (BR7A)

panels.description: -- BR7A - This query returns the average planned and unplanned downtime, average uptime and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS planned_downtime
--    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
--    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
            GROUP BY b.host_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime (BR7A)

panels.description: -- BR7A - This query returns the average planned and unplanned downtime, average uptime and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
            GROUP BY b.host_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        hourly_daily.host_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Cluster Uptime (BR7A)

panels.description: -- BR7A - This query returns the average planned and unplanned downtime, average uptime and total time per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR7A - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

SELECT
--    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
--    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime,
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
        hourly_daily.host_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                hourly_daily.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts AS b
            GROUP BY b.host_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
        hourly_daily.host_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date,
    host_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Uptime by Host (BR7A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
--    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
--    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS planned_downtime

--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
--    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
        -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
        AND high_availability = TRUE
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

                        COALESCE (

        AND high_availability = TRUE

        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a

        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter

            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'

            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime (BR14A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
        -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
        AND high_availability = TRUE
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Uptime by Cluster (BR14A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
--    delete_date,
    vm_name,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM
        (
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
         UNION
         SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
        ) AS hourly_daily
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
        -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
        AND high_availability = TRUE
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date,
    vm_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Uptime by Virtual Machine (BR14A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins
--    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total )  AS planned_downtime_mins
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
--    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Planned Downtime  (BR14A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        -- Here we get only vms of type "server"
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_type = 1
        -- Here we get only vms that are marked as "high availability"
        --AND high_availability = TRUE
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Uptime by Cluster (BR14A)

panels.description: -- BR14A - This query returns the average unplanned downtime, uptime and total time per cluster and vm server.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR14A - This query returns the
-- average unplanned downtime, uptime
-- and total time per cluster and vm server.

SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
--    delete_date AS cluster_delete_date,
    vm_name,
    CAST (high_availability AS varchar) AS high_availability,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
--    AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS uptime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
        high_availability,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_mins,
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.minutes_in_status
        ) AS total
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly.vm_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
             ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters AS a
            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
        )
        -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms AS b
            GROUP BY b.vm_id
        )
        -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
            CASE
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
              WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
            END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
        high_availability
) AS a
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    name,
    vm_name,
    high_availability,
    delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
     CAST (
        AVG ( uptime_mins )
        AS float
    ) /
    CAST (
        AVG ( total )
        AS float
    ) DESC

panels.title: Uptime by Virtual Machine (BR14A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text, datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text, datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
